beginner.name: Jumping Jacks
beginner.description: Jumping jacks are a full-body exercise that involves jumping to a position with your legs spread wide and your hands touching overhead. It's a great way to warm up your body and get your heart rate up.

beginner.name: Abdominal Crunches
beginner.description: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Place your hands behind your head, engage your core, and lift your shoulders off the ground towards your knees. Focus on contracting your abdominal muscles.

beginner.name: Russian Twist
beginner.description: Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. Lean back slightly while keeping your back straight. Lift your feet off the ground and balance on your tailbone. Hold a weight or your hands together, and twist your torso from side to side, engaging your oblique muscles.

beginner.name: Mountain Climber
beginner.description: Assume a plank position with your hands placed directly under your shoulders. Alternate bringing your knees toward your chest in a running motion while keeping your core engaged and your hips down. It's an excellent exercise for cardio and core strength.

beginner.name: Squat
beginner.description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your body by bending your knees and hips, as if sitting back into an imaginary chair. Keep your back straight and chest up. Push through your heels to return to a standing position. Squats target your quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.

beginner.name: Leg Raises
beginner.description: Lie flat on your back with your legs extended. Keep your hands under your hips for support. Slowly raise your legs upward while keeping them straight, then lower them back down without touching the floor. This targets your lower abs.

beginner.name: Plank
beginner.description: Assume a push-up position with your arms straight and your wrists aligned under your shoulders. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core muscles and hold the position, focusing on maintaining proper form.

beginner.name: Push ups
beginner.description: Assume a push-up position with your hands placed wider than shoulder-width apart. Lower your chest towards the ground by bending your elbows, then push back up. This variation targets your chest muscles and enhances upper body strength.

intermediate.name: Crossover Crunch
intermediate.description: Lie on your back with your knees bent and hands behind your head. Lift your shoulders off the ground and twist your torso, bringing your right elbow towards your left knee, then vice versa. This exercise targets your oblique muscles and upper abs.

intermediate.name: Side Bridges Left
intermediate.description: Lie on your left side, supporting your body with your left elbow and forearm. Lift your hips off the ground, forming a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core to maintain stability. This exercise strengthens your obliques and improves lateral stability.

intermediate.name: Bicycle Crunches
intermediate.description: Lie on your back with your hands behind your head. Lift your shoulders off the ground and bring your left elbow towards your right knee while extending your left leg. Alternate sides in a pedaling motion. This exercise targets your obliques and engages your entire core.

intermediate.name: V-Up
intermediate.description: Lie flat on your back with your arms extended overhead and your legs straight. Simultaneously lift your upper body and legs off the ground, forming a V shape. Lower back down with control. This exercise challenges your upper and lower abs.

intermediate.name: Wide Arm Push-Ups
intermediate.description: Assume a push-up position with your hands placed wider than shoulder-width apart. Lower your chest towards the ground by bending your elbows, then push back up. This variation targets your chest muscles and enhances upper body strength.

intermediate.name: Staggered Push-Ups
intermediate.description: Assume a push-up position with one hand placed slightly forward and the other slightly back. Lower your chest towards the ground by bending your elbows, then push back up. This exercise challenges your chest and shoulders asymmetrically.

intermediate.name: Squats
intermediate.description: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your body by bending your knees and hips, as if sitting back into an imaginary chair. Keep your back straight and chest up. Push through your heels to return to a standing position. Squats target your quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.

intermediate.name: Lunges
intermediate.description: Step forward with one leg and lower your body until both knees are bent at 90-degree angles. Push through the heel of your front foot to return to the starting position. Alternate legs with each repetition. Lunges enhance lower body strength and stability.

intermediate.name: Hover Push-Ups
intermediate.description: Start in a plank position with your elbows on the ground. Push up onto your hands one at a time, like a push-up. Lower back down onto your elbows while maintaining core stability throughout. This exercise challenges your chest and shoulders in a different way.

advanced.name: Crossover Crunch
advanced.description: Lie on your back with your knees bent and hands behind your head. Lift your shoulders off the ground and twist your torso, bringing your right elbow towards your left knee, then vice versa. This advanced variation targets your obliques and upper abs.

advanced.name: Plank
advanced.description: Assume a push-up position with your arms straight and wrists aligned under your shoulders. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels, engaging your core. Hold the position for an extended time to challenge your core strength.

advanced.name: Burpees
advanced.description: Start from a standing position, then squat down and kick your legs back to a plank position. Perform a push-up, then jump your feet back to the squat position. Explosively jump up with arms overhead. This dynamic exercise combines strength and cardio.

advanced.name: Single Leg Deadlift
advanced.description: Lift the right leg and lower the arms and torso while raising the right leg behind the body. Keep the left knee slightly bent. Raise the torso while lowering the right leg.

advanced.name: Three-way Arms
advanced.description: Perform a front raise, keeping elbows straight to lift wrists to shoulder height in front of your body. Perform a lateral raise, keeping elbows straight to lift wrists to shoulder height to the side of your body.

advanced.name: Chair Leg Squats
advanced.description: Stand on one leg, in front of a chair. Slowly squat to sit down onto the chair. You can use your other foot to guide you and balance (by tapping on the ground as needed).

advanced.name: Backward Lunge
advanced.description: Begin with a squat, then explosively jump up while swinging your arms down. Land softly and immediately transition into the next squat. This advanced plyometric exercise enhances lower body strength and power.

advanced.name: Donkey Kicks
advanced.description: Start in a reverse plank position with your fingers pointing towards your feet. Lower your hips towards the ground by bending your elbows, then push back up. This challenging exercise targets your triceps, shoulders, and core.

advanced.name: Rows
advanced.description: Tip forward at hips, keeping back straight and core muscles tight. Bend at elbows to squeeze shoulder blades backwards, tensing your mid back muscles as you do so. To progress this exercise, aim to complete it standing on one leg.

advanced.name: Lunge with Twist
advanced.description: Complete a lunge, bending at both knees to lower downwards. While in the downward lunge and with abdominal muscles tightened, complete a gentle twist to either side.
